term_description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study
Given first name
Given last name.
Valid email address
The name (or acronym) representing the lead institution responsible for the study.
An official title for the study or project. Project title should be fewer than 30 words, such as a title of a grant proposal or a publication.
term_example: Study of single cells in the human body

term_description: A detailed description of the project which includes research goals and experimental approach. Project description should be fewer than 300 words, such as an abstract from a grant application or publication.
term_example: This project explores the intricate details of single cells in the human body, focusing on their structure, function, and behavior. By studying individual cells, it aims to uncover how they contribute to overall health, disease progression, and human biology. This research can provide deeper insights into cellular processes, paving the way for advancements in medical treatments and personalised medicine.

term_description: A citation for the study resource, following a standard format.
term_example: Doe J., et al. (2024). Single Cell Transcriptomic Analysis of Human Liver Cells. Journal of Cellular Biology.

term_description: The date when the study was created or registered.
The workflow or protocol followed during the study.
A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the study.
The full scientific name of the species studied.
The full scientific name of the species studied.
An identifier of the strain of the organism, if applicable.
The type of tissue sampled for the study.
A brief description of how the sample was preserved.

The geographic latitude where the specimen or sample was taken in decimal degrees, between -90 and 90. Locations should be specified to a minimum of 3 decimal places and a maximum of 8 decimal places.
The longitude of the sample collection site, in decimal degrees.
Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling.
A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier assigned to the sample in the study related to NCBI Taxonomy.
A description of the behaviour shown by the subject at the time the dwc:Occurrence was recorded.
A unique alphanumeric identifier for the imaging protocol.
The platform used to isolate the cells.
The instrument used to isolate the cells.
The method used for dissociating the cells.
The time duration for dissociation in minutes.
The temperature at which dissociation is performed in degrees celsius.
The enzyme used for dissociation.
The concentration of the dissociation enzyme.
The temperature at which the material is incubated in degrees C.
The time duration for material incubation in hours.
The solution used for lysis buffer.
The type of probes used to detect and quantify specific RNA molecules in their native spatial context within a tissue or cell.
The thickness of the tissue section in micrometres.
The method used to measure tissue section thickness.
The temperature at which the section was made.
A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being abnormal and having a destructive effect on living tissue.
A link to a workflow describing the digestion protocol in Protocols.io
The duration of digestion in minutes.
The temperature at which digestion was carried out.
The duration of photobleaching in hours
The user guide for the instrument used.
The revision of the instrument user guide.
The guide used for sample preparation.
The revision of the sample preparation guide.
Any deviations from the official protocol. Separate individual deviations with '|'.
term_example: Temperature exceeded 25°C during storage | Sample handling delayed by 2 hours

term_description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the library preparation protocol used during the sequencing.
A unique alphanumeric code for the cell suspension for the library preparation.
The version number of the library preparation kit used for sequencing.
The method used to amplify the Complementary DNA (cDNA).
The number of cycles used during the Complementary DNA (cDNA) amplification process.
The average length of RNA fragments in base pairs (BP) after library preparation, indicating the quality and suitability of the RNA for sequencing.
The library construction method (including version) that was used.
The specific fraction of biological macromolecule from which the sequencing library is derived.
The type of primer used for reverse transcription. This allows users to identify content of the cDNA library input for mRNA.
The end from which the molecule was sequenced.
The end bias of the library.
The Complementary DNA (cDNA) strand of the library from which the reads derived from - sense (first), antisense (second), both or none.
External RNA added to the sample as a control to assess technical variability and normalization in RNA-sequencing. State whether spike-in was used.
The final concentration or dilution (for commercial sets) of the spike in mix.
A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the sequencing protocol.

term_label: Technical Replicate Group Or Library Reference
term_description: A common term for all runs or files belonging to the same cell or library. It is recommended to use a stable sample accession from a biosample archive like BioSample. Alternatively, the library ID can be referenced from which the files were generated.
The name of the sequencing platform used for the experiment.
This refers to the specific machine or platform used to carry out the sequencing process. Different models can have varying throughput, read lengths, error rates, and application suitability.
The type of library layout used for sequencing.
The number of sequencing reads generated per sample.
The type of read that contains the UMI barcode:
The offset in sequence of the UUnique Molecular Identifier (UMI)MI identifying barcode.
The size of the Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI) identifying barcode.
The type of read that contains the UMI barcode.

The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode.
E.g. "0".

The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode.
E.g. "0".
The type of read that contains the Complementary DNA (cDNA) read.
The type of read that contains the Complementary DNA (cDNA) read.
The size of the cDNA read. E.g. "100".
The type of read that contains the sample barcode.
The offset in sequence of the sample identifying barcode.
The size of the read that contains the sample barcode.
A unique alphanumeric identifier for the imaging protocol.
A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the library preparation protocol used during the sequencing.
A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the sequencing protocol.
The name of the file that contains read 1.
The name of the file that contains read 2.
The name of the file that contains index 1.
The name of the file that contains index 2.

Result of a hash function calculated on the content of both the read 1 file and the read 2 file to verify file integrity. Commonly used algorithms include MD5 and SHA-1. The checksums should be separated by a comma (,).

Result of a hash function calculated on the content of both the index 1 file and the index 2 file to verify file integrity. Commonly used algorithms include MD5 and SHA-1. The checksums should be separated by a comma (,).

A file containing the known cell barcodes in the
dataset.
The name of the file that was used to generate the analysis derived data.
Post analysis cell type or identity declaration based on expression profile or known gene function identified by the performer.

Performer defined measure of whether the read output
from the cell was included in the sequencing analysis. For example, cells might be excluded if a threshold percentage of reads did not map to the genome or if pre-sequencing quality measures were not passed.
Any other cell level measurement or annotation as result of the analysis.
